success extract queries from components - 1.510s
warn The GraphQL query in the non-page component
warn The GraphQL query in the non-page component
Exported queries are only executed for Page components. It's possible you're
trying to create pages in your gatsby-node.js and that's failing for some
reason.

If the failing component(s) is a regular component and not intended to be a page
component, you generally want to use a <StaticQuery> (https://gatsbyjs.org/docs/static-query)
instead of exporting a page query.

If you're more experienced with GraphQL, you can also export GraphQL
fragments from components and compose the fragments in the Page component
query and pass data down into the child component — https://graphql.org/learn/queries/#fragments

series-hero-description"><span style="font-weight:400">When a national emergency hits, we know Christ can help protect your family and even overcome fear with bold faith during uncertain times. In the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic of 2020, these messages from Liquid Church will help you turn to God in times of uncertainty, care for your soul in a time of crisis, and highlights ways the church can show the love of Jesus to our neighbors-in-need!</span></div></div></div></div></section><section class="fullwidth-section media-cards" style="background-color:#F8F8F8"><div class="layout__content" style="min-height:400px"><article class="post"><section id="message-viewer"><div class="message-player-container container-fluid"><div class="message-player"><iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/416563374" width="0" height="0" frameBorder="0" allow="autoplay; fullscreen" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div></div></section><section class="fullwidth-section message-info-section"><div class="container"><div class="message-info-title row"><div class="col-md-8 col-12 order-md-1 order-1"><h2 class="font-h2 message-title">Parenting in a Pandemic</h2></div><div class="col-md-4 col-12 order-md-2 order-3"><h2 class="font-h3">Social Icon Placeholder</h2></div><div class="col-md-12 col-12 order-md-3 order-2"><div class="font-h3 message-speaker">Kayra Montanez</div><div class="font=h3 message-date">May 10, 2020</div></div></div><hr class="message-hr"/><div class="row"><div class="col-12"><div class="font-large message-description"><p>The way to parent during this pandemic is to remember that all God is asking of us is to parent faithfully by choosing to be present over perfect and remembering that suffering well produces godly character!</p></div></div><div class="message-scripture col-12"><h6 class="font-h3 message-speaker message-scripture-header">Scriptures: </h6><div class="font-h3 message-scripture-text">1 Cor 7:1-5, Matthew 20:20-28</div></div><div class="col-12"><div class="message-tag-cloud"><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/covid-19"><span class="tag-icon message-tag-icon"></span><span class="font-h3 message-tag-text">COVID-19</span></a><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/faithfulness"><span class="tag-icon message-tag-icon"></span><span class="font-h3 message-tag-text">Faithfulness</span></a><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/pandemic"><span class="tag-icon message-tag-icon"></span><span class="font-h3 message-tag-text">Pandemic</span></a><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/parenting"><span class="tag-icon message-tag-icon"></span><span class="font-h3 message-tag-text">Parenting</span></a></div></div></div></div></section><section class="fullwidth-section series-title-section" style="background-color:#f8F8F8"><div class="container"><div class="row"><div class="col-md-12 col-12 offset-md-0 offset-0"><h6 class="font-section-header">Message Series</h6></div><div class="col-lg-6 col-12"><a href="/series/in-case-of-emergency"><img sizes="90vw" class="message-tile-image" class="series-title-block"><h4 class="font-h2 series-title">In Case of Emergency</h4><div class="font-regular series-description"><span style="font-weight:400">When a national emergency hits, we know Christ can help protect your family and even overcome fear with bold faith during uncertain times. In the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic of 2020, these messages from Liquid Church will help you turn to God in times of uncertainty, care for your soul in a time of crisis, and highlights ways the church can show the love of Jesus to our neighbors-in-need!</span></div></div></div></div></div></section><section class="fullwidth-section media-cards" style="background-color:#F8F8F8"><div   body: '<div style="outline:none" tabindex="-1" id="gatsby-focus-wrapper"><div><div class="container-fluid"><header id="header" class="header"><div><div class="bm-overlay" 0);-o-transform:translate3d(100%, 0, 0);-webkit-transform:translate3d(100%, 0, 0);transform:translate3d(100%, 0, 0);transition:opacity 0.3s, transform 0s 0.3s"></div><div id="menu-nav" class="bm-menu-wrap" style="position:fixed;right:inherit;z-index:1100;width:320px;height:100%;-moz-transform:translate3d(-100%, 0, 0);-ms-transform:translate3d(-100%, 0, id="bm-close-bottom" class="btn bm-cross-button" tabindex="-1" aria-hidden="true" aria-label="Close Main Menu Drawer"><i fill="currentColor" class="col"></div></div><div class="row"><div class="col"><nav aria-label="Header Menu" class="topbar-dark d-flex navbar navbar-expand-true navbar-dark bg-test"><div class="topbar-icon col"><button id="header-icon" class="btn btn-topbar-icon burger-icon topbar-icon-dark" aria-label="Open Main Menu Drawer" tabindex="0"></button></div><div class="topbar-brand col"><a id="liquid-header" aria-label="Liquid Church Home" class="btn btn-topbar-brand liquid-brand theme-icon-dark" href="/"></a></div><div class="col"><div class="topbar-menu d-sm-none d-lg-flex navbar-nav"><a class="btn topbar-menu-item btn-topbar-menu-dark" href="/about/">About Us</a><a class="btn topbar-menu-item btn-topbar-menu-dark" href="/locations/">Locations</a><a class="btn topbar-menu-item btn-topbar-menu-dark" href="/media/">Media</a><a class="btn topbar-menu-item btn-topbar-menu-dark" href="/give/">Give</a></div></div><div class="topbar-chop col"><a class="btn btn-sm topbar-chop-button topbar-button-dark" href="/live">Watch Church Online</a></div><div class="topbar-icon col"><a class="btn btn-topbar-icon magnifier-icon topbar-icon-dark" href="/search"></a></div></nav></div></div><div class="row"><div class="col"><nav aria-label="Mobile Menu" class="mobile-menu navbar navbar-expand navbar-light bg-light fixed-bottom"><div role="group" class="mobile-menu-burger btn-group"><button class="btn btn-mobile-menu-burger burger-icon" aria-label="Open Main Menu Drawer"></button></div><div role="group" class="mobile-menu-group btn-group"><a class="btn btn-mobile-menu" href="/about/"><div class="mobile-menu-icon about-us-icon"></div><div class="mobile-menu-text">About Us</div></a><a class="btn btn-mobile-menu" href="/locations/"><div class="mobile-menu-icon locations-icon"></div><div class="mobile-menu-text">Locations</div></a><a class="btn btn-mobile-menu" href="/media/"><div class="mobile-menu-icon media-icon"></div><div class="mobile-menu-text">Media</div></a><a class="btn btn-mobile-menu" href="/give/"><div class="mobile-menu-icon give-icon"></div><div class="mobile-menu-text">Give</div></a><a class="btn btn-mobile-menu" href="/live"><div class="mobile-menu-chop-icon chop-icon"></div><div class="mobile-menu-text two-line">Church Online</div></a></div></nav></div></div></header><main id="main" class="layout__content" style="min-height:400px"><article class="post"><div class="post__blocks"><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-regular">What worship songs are you listening to right now? In the hustle and bustle of our everyday lives, we can regularly take some time to slow down and give God the praise and honor that He so deserves. At Liquid Church, one of the ways we do this is through worship. Through musical worship, we listen to songs of truth, adoration, and surrender to help us focus our attention on God rather than ourselves or our circumstances. By doing this, we are able to set aside the troubles of this world and worship Him for who He truly is.</p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-regular">At Liquid, we believe that musical worship is a powerful way for every believer to connect with the heart of God. So, it is our joy to share <strong>10 worship songs to listen to right now</strong> with you this week! We encourage you to take the time each day to listen to a new song <em>and</em> to make that song the theme for your day. We hope this playlist will inspire your worship in a fresh new way! </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="10"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A1Ljl32SqRc"><strong>Kim Walker-Smith - “Throne Room”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-regular">As Christians, we have a God that wants us to boldly come before Him (<a href="https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Hebrews%204:16&amp;version=NIV">Hebrews 4:16</a>), not only in our prayers but also in our worship of Him. The chorus of “Throne Room” emphasizes this genuine worship and how humbled we become when we come before a holy God. Let this song encourage you to run into His presence — it will leave you filled with awe and wonder! </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="9"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4FC0NYDE14E"><strong>Amanda Lindsey Cook - “Awakening”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-regular">Loosely inspired by <a href="https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Lamentations+3%3A22-23&amp;version=NIV">Lamentations 3:22-23</a>, this original song not only praises God for the many ways He redeems us each day, but it also serves as a testimony to artist Amanda Lindsey Cook’s faith despite her open struggles with anxiety and depression. Even in our struggles, God has the power to give us new life. Just like Cook, we hope your spirit will be awakened by this song, too! </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="8"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iFw42tZVDKI"><strong>Lauren Daigle - “Here’s My Heart”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-regular">As we grow up, we become so used to the idea of independence and doing everything on our own that we often forget to rely on God for anything. This song recaptures the beautiful picture of childlike dependence on our Heavenly Father… the way He created us to be. </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="7"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rHlRSZkz5vU"><strong>Brian &amp; Jenn Johnson - “Gravity”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-regular">During times of stress or anxiety, we can become so caught up in our problems that we lose sight of what matters most to God — spending time in His presence. This song will help you do just that. </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="6"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M9GcyHpptMk"><strong>Hillsong UNITED - “Oceans (Where Feet May Fail)”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-regular">Inspired by <a href="https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Matthew+14%3A22-32&amp;version=NIV">Matthew 14:22-32</a> where Jesus calls Peter out onto the water in a step of faith, this worship classic reveals that Jesus’ character will never fail, even when our feet do. It is only in His presence that we will be made stronger in our faith (<a href="https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=James+1%3A2-4&amp;version=NIV">James 1:2-4</a>). Allow this song to soak into your heart, and let God speak to you while worshiping Him. We hope these lyrics will be your soul’s anthem — <em>“Spirit lead me where my trust is without borders/Let me walk upon the waters wherever you would call me/Take me deeper than my feet could ever wander/And my faith will be made stronger in the presence of my Savior.”</em> </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="5"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XFkDqQtfs0w"><strong>Steffany Gretzinger - “Out of Hiding (Father’s Song)”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-regular">Written by singer-songwriters Steffany Gretzinger and Amanda Lindsey Cook, this song imagines what it would be like for the Father to call to His children, <em>“Come out of hiding.”</em> And the outro of the song — <em>“Baby, you’re almost home now/Please don’t quit now/You’re almost home to me”</em> — will be sure to connect you to the Father’s heart. </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="4"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6xx0d3R2LoU"><strong>Cory Asbury - “Reckless Love”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-regular">Many worship songs speak of God’s love for us, but none are quite like the award-winning original “Reckless Love.” Based on the Parable of the Lost Sheep in <a href="https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Luke+15%3A1-7&amp;version=NIV">Luke 15:1-7</a>, this song praises God for His unconditional love that never gives up on us, even when we don’t deserve His kindness. Even though you may have listened to the song in church a million times before, we encourage you to take some time to really listen to the lyrics and worship the God that recklessly loves you. </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="3"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aFxOGd4P4JA"><strong>Kari Jobe - “Speak To Me”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-regular">What a great privilege it is to speak with the Creator of the universe! As followers of Christ, we make it a priority to pray to God each day, and He welcomes that. But how many of us let Him speak to us? Instead of hearing God’s voice, we only hear our own words, acting as if prayer is a one-way monologue rather than a two-way conversation. Allow this calming song to create a desire to listen to Him. </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="2"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3WPbs7N-E0Q"><strong>Bethel Music &amp; Brian Johnson - “Have It All”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-regular">With Brian Johnson as the worship leader, this song was born out of a difficult time for the artist as he struggled with an intense nervous breakdown. His song “Have It All” is one of vulnerably surrendering everything before God. Once we can let go of our control and desires, we are truly able to sing the chorus — <em>“You can have it all, Lord/Every part of my world/Take this life and breathe on/This heart that is now yours.”</em> </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zp6aygmvzM4"><strong>Elevation Worship ft. Kari Jobe &amp; Cody Carnes - “The Blessing”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-regular">Released just a week before the coronavirus pandemic hit the U.S., “The Blessing” could not have come at a more opportune time. Full of scriptural references, this song declares God’s blessing and protection over His children. In fact, the first verse of the song is taken directly from <a href="https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Numbers+6%3A24-26&amp;version=NIV">Numbers 6:24-26</a>, where God revealed the Priestly Blessing benediction to Moses which was to be spoken over the people of Israel in ancient times. Even today, this benediction song is now more relevant than ever. We anticipate that both the powerful words and entrancing melody will soon make this song a new worship favorite among churches. </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-regular"></p></div></div></div></article></main><footer id="footer" class="footer"><div class="container"><div class="d-flex row"><div class="footer-liquid-app col-sm-6 col-12"><a class="liquid-app-download" href="/app"><div class="liquid-app-icon liquid-icon"></div><div class="liquid-app-text">Download the <br/> Liquid Church App</div><div class="liquid-app-arrow"><i fill="currentColor" style="display:inline-block;vertical-align:text-bottom"><svg fill="currentColor" style="display:inline-block;vertical-align:middle" height="30" width="30" viewBox="0 0 20 20"><path d="M13.25,10L6.109,2.58c-0.268-0.27-0.268-0.707,0-0.979c0.268-0.27,0.701-0.27,0.969,0l7.83,7.908\r\n' +
    '\tc0.268,0.271,0.268,0.709,0,0.979l-7.83,7.908c-0.268,0.271-0.701,0.27-0.969,0c-0.268-0.269-0.268-0.707,0-0.979L13.25,10z"></path></svg></i></div></a></div><div class="footer-to-top col-sm-6 col-12"></div></div><div class="d-flex row"><div block="true" class="footer-copyright-padding col-lg-4 col-sm-12 col-12 order-lg-1 order-sm-3 order-3"><div class="screen-reader-only">Copyright 2020 Liquid Church</div><span class="footer-font" aria-hidden="true" style="color:#757575;text-decoration:none"><i fill="currentColor" style="display:inline-block;color:#949494;vertical-align:text-bottom"><svg fill="currentColor" style="display:inline-block;vertical-align:middle" height="16" width="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M10.08 10.86c.05-.33.16-.62.3-.87s.34-.46.59-.62c.24-.15.54-.22.91-.23.23.01.44.05.63.13.2.09.38.21.52.36s.25.33.34.53.13.42.14.64h1.79c-.02-.47-.11-.9-.28-1.29s-.4-.73-.7-1.01-.66-.5-1.08-.66-.88-.23-1.39-.23c-.65 0-1.22.11-1.7.34s-.88.53-1.2.92-.56.84-.71 1.36S8 11.29 8 11.87v.27c0 .58.08 1.12.23 1.64s.39.97.71 1.35.72.69 1.2.91 1.05.34 1.7.34c.47 0 .91-.08 1.32-.23s.77-.36 1.08-.63.56-.58.74-.94.29-.74.3-1.15h-1.79c-.01.21-.06.4-.15.58s-.21.33-.36.46-.32.23-.52.3c-.19.07-.39.09-.6.1-.36-.01-.66-.08-.89-.23-.25-.16-.45-.37-.59-.62s-.25-.55-.3-.88-.08-.67-.08-1v-.27c0-.35.03-.68.08-1.01zM12 2C6.48 2 2 6.48 2 12s4.48 10 10 10 10-4.48 10-10S17.52 2 12 2zm0 18c-4.41 0-8-3.59-8-8s3.59-8 8-8 8 3.59 8 8-3.59 8-8 8z"></path></svg></i> <!-- -->2020<!-- --> <!-- -->LiquidChurch.</span><span class="photo-tab-body-col col-md-6 col-12 order-md-1 order-2"><h2 class="statement medium short light align-left">Impact the Next Generation</h2><div class="sidekick medium short light align-left">A phase is a timeframe in kids’ lives when we can leverage distinctive opportunities to influence their future. That means the whining toddler, the dramatic fifth grader, and the stressed-out tenth grader are not just “going through a phase” that should be wished away; rather, they are transitioning through critical periods that we are called to discover, celebrate, and navigate strategically with them</div><div class="cta medium short light align-left"><a class="cta-text font-link left short" style="background-color:;border:0px" href="/kids"><span class="" style="background-color:"></span><div class="cta-label">liquid family</div><i fill="currentColor" style="display:inline-block;vertical-align:text-bottom"><svg fill="currentColor" style="display:inline-block;vertical-align:middle" height="16" width="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M12 4l-1.41 class="photo-tab-body-col col-md-6 col-12 order-md-2 order-2"><h2 class="statement medium short light align-left">Prayer</h2><div class="sidekick medium short light align-left">Alterum significari idem, ut si diceretur, officia media omnia aut pleraque servantem vivere. Cuius similitudine <em>perspecta in formarum specie</em> ac dignitate transitum est ad honestatem dictorum atque factorum. Cum id fugiunt, re eadem defendunt, quae Peripatetici, verba. Quid igitur dubitamus in tota eius natura quaerere quid sit effectum</div><div class="cta medium short light align-left"></div><h2 class="photo-tab-tag font-h1">Secondary Header</h2><div class="photo-tab-text font-regular"><strong>Alterum significari </strong>idem, ut si diceretur, officia media omnia aut pleraque servantem vivere. Cuius similitudine <em>perspecta in formarum specie</em> ac dignitate transitum est ad honestatem dictorum atque factorum. Cum id fugiunt, re eadem defendunt, quae Peripatetici, verba. Quid igitur dubitamus in tota eius natura quaerere quid sit effectum</div></div></div></div></section></div></article></main><footer id="footer" class="footer"><div class="container"><div class="d-flex row"><div class="footer-liquid-app col-sm-6 col-12"><a class="liquid-app-download" href="/app"><div class="liquid-app-icon liquid-icon"></div><div class="liquid-app-text">Download the <br/> Liquid Church App</div><div class="liquid-app-arrow"><i fill="currentColor" style="display:inline-block;vertical-align:text-bottom"><svg fill="currentColor" style="display:inline-block;vertical-align:middle" height="30" width="30" viewBox="0 0 20 20"><path d="M13.25,10L6.109,2.58c-0.268-0.27-0.268-0.707,0-0.979c0.268-0.27,0.701-0.27,0.969,0l7.83,7.908\r\n' +

style="background-color:#F8f8f8"><div class="container"><div class="row"></div><div class="row"><div class="media-card-wrap col"><a class="media-card-link" font-h1">The Church was never about buildings.</h1><p class="homepage-hero-text font-large">The Church has always been about people rallying together, following Jesus, and sharing God&#x27;s love with our neighbors. While the methods change, the mission never does. During this time, where large gatherings are limited, we can still be part of God&#x27;s mission and be the Church.</p><div class="homepage-hero-cta"><a id="hero-cta" class="btn font-btn-large blue-btn" href="/live">Watch Church Online</a></div></div></div></section><section class="site-section both" style="background-color:#F8F8F8"><div class="container"><div class="row"><div class="page-strap-col vertical-center col"><h2 class="statement large tall light align-center">No matter who you are or where you&#x27;ve been, you&#x27;re welcome here.</h2><div class="sidekick large tall light align-center">At Liquid, you&#x27;ll be welcomed into a friendly, casual environment by people who are excited to see you. All you have to do from here is come as you are and find out more for yourself!</div><div class="cta large tall light align-center"><a class="cta-text font-link center" style="color:#009dd1;;background-color:;border:0px" href="/about"><span class="" style="background-color:"></span><div class="cta-label" style="color:#009dd1;">Learn more about us</div><i message-info-section"><div class="container"><div class="message-info-title row"><div class="col-md-8 col-12 order-md-1 order-1"><h2 class="font-h2 message-title">Put On Your Own Mask First</h2></div><div class="col-md-4 col-12 order-md-2 order-3"><h2 class="font-h3">Social Icon Placeholder</h2></div><div class="col-md-12 col-12 order-md-3 order-2"><div class="font-h3 message-speaker">Karen Shannon, Tim Lucas</div><div class="font=h3 message-date">Apr 19, 2020</div></div></div><hr class="message-hr"/><div class="row"><div class="col-12"><div class="font-large message-description"><p>It’s impossible to help those you love if you don’t take care of your own soul first. Discover 6 ways to care for yourself physically, emotionally, and spiritually during the COVID crisis.</p></div></div><div class="message-scripture col-12"><h6 class="font-h3 message-speaker message-scripture-header">Scriptures: </h6><div class="font-h3 message-scripture-text">1 Timothy 5:8, Mark 6:31-32, Matthew 6:34, Philippians 4:8, Psalm 23:1-3, Psalm 62:8</div></div><div class="col-12"><div class="message-tag-cloud"><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/covid-19"><span class="tag-icon message-tag-icon"></span><span class="font-h3 message-tag-text">COVID-19</span></a><a Christ can help protect your family and even overcome fear with bold faith during uncertain times. In the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic of 2020, these messages from Liquid Church will help you turn to God in times of uncertainty, care for your soul in a time of crisis, and highlights ways the church can show the love of Jesus to our neighbors-in-need!</span></div></div></div></div></div></section><section class="fullwidth-section media-cards" style="background-color:#F8F8F8"><div class="layout__content" style="min-height:400px"><article class="post"><section id="message-viewer"><div class="message-player-container container-fluid"><div class="message-player"><iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/406965516" width="0" height="0" frameBorder="0" allow="autoplay; fullscreen" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div></div></section><section class="fullwidth-section message-info-section"><div class="container"><div class="message-info-title row"><div class="col-md-8 col-12 order-md-1 order-1"><h2 class="font-h2 message-title">Bittersweet Easter</h2></div><div class="col-md-4 col-12 order-md-2 order-3"><h2 class="font-h3">Social Icon Placeholder</h2></div><div class="col-md-12 col-12 order-md-3 order-2"><div class="font-h3 message-speaker">Tim Lucas</div><div class="font=h3 message-date">Apr 12, 2020</div></div></div><hr class="message-hr"/><div class="row"><div class="col-12"><div class="font-large message-description"><p>In the midst of a painful pandemic, Easter can feel surreal. When those we love suffer &amp; Jesus doesn’t help right away, we can wonder “Where’s God in all this?” But Easter shows that Christ is with us when we suffer– and He’s planning something even better!</p></div></div><div class="message-scripture col-12"><h6 class="font-h3 message-speaker message-scripture-header">Scriptures: </h6><div class="font-h3 message-scripture-text">John 11:1-44</div></div><div class="col-12"><div class="message-tag-cloud"><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/anger"><span class="tag-icon message-tag-icon"></span><span class="font-h3 message-tag-text">Anger</span></a><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/covid-19"><span class="tag-icon message-tag-icon"></span><span class="font-h3 message-tag-text">COVID-19</span></a><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/cross"><span class="tag-icon message-tag-icon"></span><span class="font-h3 message-tag-text">Cross</span></a><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/easter"><span class="tag-icon message-tag-icon"></span><span class="font-h3 message-tag-text">Easter</span></a><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/grief"><span class="tag-icon message-tag-icon"></span><span href="/tag/salvation"><span class="tag-icon message-tag-icon"></span><span class="font-h3 message-tag-text">Salvation</span></a><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/suffering"><span class="tag-icon class="series-title-block"><h4 class="font-h2 series-title">Easter 2020</h4><div class="font-regular series-description"><span style="font-weight:400">In this unprecedented time of uncertainty and fear, it might seem strange to celebrate. But on Easter weekend, we can experience fresh HOPE from the life-changing power of Jesus&#x27; resurrection! Amidst this crisis, let&#x27;s come together as a community and choose faith over fear, peace over panic, and worship over worry! Our Easter message will inspire your whole family as we&#x27;re reminded: This pandemic is not permanent-- but our hope in Christ is! </span></div></div></div></div></div></section><section class="col-md-4 col-12 order-md-2 order-3"><h2 class="font-h3">Social Icon Placeholder</h2></div><div class="col-md-12 col-12 order-md-3 order-2"><div class="font-h3 message-speaker">Tim Lucas</div><div class="font=h3 message-date">Apr 5, 2020</div></div></div><hr class="message-hr"/><div class="row"><div class="col-12"><div class="font-large message-description"><p>When a national emergency hits, the Church has a chance to share &amp; show the love of Jesus to our neighbors-in-need. class="series-title-block"><h4 class="font-h2 series-title">In Case of Emergency</h4><div class="font-regular series-description"><span style="font-weight:400">When a national emergency hits, we know Christ can help protect your family and even overcome fear with bold faith during uncertain times. In the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic of 2020, these messages from Liquid Church will help you turn to God in times of uncertainty, care for your soul in a time of crisis, and highlights ways the church can show the love of Jesus to our neighbors-in-need!</span></div></div></div></div></div></section><section class="fullwidth-section media-cards" style="background-color:#F8F8F8"><div src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/401577768" width="0" height="0" frameBorder="0" allow="autoplay; fullscreen" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div></div></section><section class="fullwidth-section message-info-section"><div class="container"><div class="message-info-title row"><div class="col-md-8 col-12 order-md-1 order-1"><h2 class="font-h2 message-title">The Battle Belongs To God</h2></div><div class="col-md-4 col-12 order-md-2 order-3"><h2 class="font-h3">Social Icon Placeholder</h2></div><div class="col-md-12 col-12 order-md-3 order-2"><div class="font-h3 message-speaker">Tim Lucas</div><div class="font=h3 message-date">Mar 29, 2020</div></div></div><hr class="message-hr"/><div class="row"><div class="col-12"><div class="font-large message-description"><p>We waste a lot of energy worrying about battles that aren’t ours to fight! In hard times, worship is a weapon that brings the victory. Give God his battle back and watch Him turn your battlefield into a blessing!</p></div></div><div class="message-scripture col-12"><h6 class="font-h3 message-speaker message-scripture-header">Scriptures: </h6><div class="font-h3 message-scripture-text">2 Chronicles 20</div></div><div class="col-12"><div class="message-tag-cloud"><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/covid-19"><span class="tag-icon message-tag-icon"></span><span class="font-h3 message-tag-text">COVID-19</span></a><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/faith"><span class="tag-icon class="series-title-block"><h4 class="font-h2 series-title">In Case of Emergency</h4><div class="font-regular series-description"><span style="font-weight:400">When a national emergency hits, we know Christ can help protect your family and even overcome fear with bold faith during uncertain times. In the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic of 2020, these messages from Liquid Church will help you turn to God in times of uncertainty, care for your soul in a time of crisis, and highlights ways the church can show the love of Jesus to our neighbors-in-need!</span></div></div></div></div></div></section><section class="fullwidth-section media-cards" style="background-color:#F8F8F8"><div src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/399744164" width="0" height="0" frameBorder="0" allow="autoplay; fullscreen" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div></div></section><section class="fullwidth-section message-info-section"><div class="container"><div class="message-info-title row"><div class="col-md-8 col-12 order-md-1 order-1"><h2 class="font-h2 message-title">Psalm 91: God’s Promise of Protection</h2></div><div class="col-md-4 col-12 order-md-2 order-3"><h2 class="font-h3">Social Icon Placeholder</h2></div><div class="col-md-12 col-12 order-md-3 order-2"><div class="font-h3 message-speaker">Tim Lucas</div><div class="font=h3 message-date">Mar 22, 2020</div></div></div><hr class="message-hr"/><div class="row"><div class="col-12"><div class="font-large message-description"><p>Psalm 91 is a powerful prayer for God’s protection in a time of global pandemic. Learn how Christ can help protect your family and overcome fear with bold faith during uncertain times.</p></div></div><div class="message-scripture col-12"><h6 class="font-h3 message-speaker message-scripture-header">Scriptures: </h6><div class="font-h3 message-scripture-text">Psalm 91</div></div><div class="col-12"><div class="message-tag-cloud"><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/covid-19"><span class="tag-icon message-tag-icon"></span><span class="font-h3 message-tag-text">COVID-19</span></a><a class="message-tag" href="/tag/faith"><span class="tag-icon class="series-title-block"><h4 class="font-h2 series-title">In Case of Emergency</h4><div class="font-regular series-description"><span style="font-weight:400">When a national emergency hits, we know Christ can help protect your family and even overcome fear with bold faith during uncertain times. In the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic of 2020, these messages from Liquid Church will help you turn to God in times of uncertainty, care for your soul in a time of crisis, and highlights ways the church can show the love of Jesus to our neighbors-in-need!</span></div></div></div></div></div></section><section class="fullwidth-section media-cards" style="background-color:#F8F8F8"><div href="/support/coaching-network/">Coaching Network</a></li><li class="bm-subcat-list-item"><a id="megamenu-Support-Help for Churches" aria-label="Support Help for Churches" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1" class="bm-subcat-item" href="/support/help-for-churches/">Help for Churches</a></li><li class="bm-subcat-list-item"><a id="megamenu-Support-Facility Rentals" aria-label="Support Facility Rentals" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1" class="bm-subcat-item" href="/support/facility-rentals/">Facility Rentals</a></li></ul></div><div class="col-6"><p class="bm-subcat-header" aria-hidden="true">Milestones</p><ul class="bm-subcat-list"><li class="bm-subcat-list-item"><a id="megamenu-Milestones-Baptism" aria-label="Milestones Baptism" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1" class="bm-subcat-item" href="/milestones/baptism/">Baptism</a></li><li class="bm-subcat-list-item"><a id="megamenu-Milestones-Baby Dedications" aria-label="Milestones Baby Dedications" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1" class="bm-subcat-item" href="/milestones/baby-dedications/">Baby Dedications</a></li><li class="bm-subcat-list-item"><a id="megamenu-Milestones-Marriage" aria-label="Milestones Marriage" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1" class="bm-subcat-item" href="/milestones/marriage/">Marriage</a></li><li class="bm-subcat-list-item"><a id="megamenu-Milestones-Funerals" aria-label="Milestones Funerals" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1" class="bm-subcat-item" href="/milestones/funerals/">Funerals</a></li></ul></div></div><button id="bm-close-bottom" class="btn bm-cross-button" tabindex="-1" aria-hidden="true" aria-label="Close Main Menu Drawer"><i fill="currentColor" style="display:inline-block;color:#949494;vertical-align:text-bottom"><svg fill="currentColor" style="display:inline-block;vertical-align:middle" height="28" width="28" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M19 6.41L17.59 5 12 10.59 6.41 5 5 6.41 10.59 12 5 17.59 6.41 19 12 13.41 17.59 19 19 17.59 13.41 12z"></path></svg></i></button></div></nav></div></div></div><div class="row"><div class="col"></div></div><div class="row"><div class="col"><nav aria-label="Header Menu" class="topbar-dark d-flex navbar navbar-expand-true navbar-dark bg-test"><div class="topbar-icon col"><button id="header-icon" class="btn btn-topbar-icon burger-icon topbar-icon-dark" aria-label="Open Main Menu Drawer" tabindex="0"></button></div><div class="topbar-brand col"><a id="liquid-header" aria-label="Liquid Church Home" class="btn btn-topbar-brand liquid-brand theme-icon-dark" href="/"></a></div><div class="col"><div class="topbar-menu d-sm-none d-lg-flex navbar-nav"><a class="btn topbar-menu-item btn-topbar-menu-dark" href="/about/">About Us</a><a class="btn topbar-menu-item btn-topbar-menu-dark" href="/locations/">Locations</a><a class="btn topbar-menu-item topbar-chop-button topbar-button-dark" href="/live">Watch Church Online</a></div><div class="topbar-icon col"><a class="btn btn-topbar-icon magnifier-icon topbar-icon-dark" href="/search"></a></div></nav></div></div><div class="row"><div class="col"><nav aria-label="Mobile Menu" class="mobile-menu navbar navbar-expand navbar-light bg-light fixed-bottom"><div role="group" class="mobile-menu-burger btn-group"><button class="btn btn-mobile-menu-burger burger-icon" aria-label="Open Main Menu Drawer"></button></div><div role="group" class="mobile-menu-group btn-group"><a class="btn btn-mobile-menu" href="/about/"><div class="mobile-menu-icon about-us-icon"></div><div class="mobile-menu-text">About Us</div></a><a class="btn btn-mobile-menu" href="/locations/"><div btn-mobile-menu" href="/live"><div class="mobile-menu-chop-icon chop-icon"></div><div class="mobile-menu-text two-line">Church Online</div></a></div></nav></div></div></header><main id="main" class="layout__content" style="min-height:400px"><article class="page"><section class="fullwidth-section"><div class="hero-image-container-fixed container"><div class="row"><img sizes="100vw" class="hero-image-fixed" src="https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2" srcSet="https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=100 100w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=512 512w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=594 594w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=688 688w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=798 798w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=926 926w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=1074 1074w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=1246 1246w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=1446 1446w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=1678 1678w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=1946 1946w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=2258 2258w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=2618 2618w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=3038 3038w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=3524 3524w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=4088 4088w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=4742 4742w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=5500 5500w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=6380 6380w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=7400 7400w, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/blogs-feature/Top-Songs-Slide.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=8192 8192w"/></div><div class="row"><div class="col-md-8 col-12 order-md-1 order-1"><h2 class="font-h2 feature-hero-title">10 Worship Songs To Listen To Right Now</h2></div><div class="col-md-4 col-12 order-md-2 order-3"><h2 class="font-h3">Social Icon Placeholder</h2></div><div class="col-md-12 col-12 order-md-3 order-2"><div class="font-h3 message-speaker">Brooke LeMunyon</div><div class="font=h3 message-date">Aug 6, 2020</div></div></div></div></section><div class="blog"><div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-medium font-dropCap p--left">What worship songs are you listening to right now? In the hustle and bustle of our everyday lives, we can regularly take some time to slow down and give God the praise and honor that He so deserves. At Liquid Church, one of the ways we do this is through <strong>worship.</strong> Through musical worship, we lis<span class="has-inline-color has-very-dark-gray-color">ten to songs of trut</span>h, adoration, and surrender to help us focus our attention on God rather than ourselves or our circumstances. By doing this, we are able to set aside the troubles of this world and worship Him for who He truly is.</p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-medium">At Liquid, we believe that musical worship is a powerful way for every believer to connect with the heart of God. So, it is our joy to share <strong>10 worship songs to listen to right now</strong> with you this week! We encourage you to take the time each day to listen to a new song <em>and</em> to make that song the theme for your day. We hope this playlist will inspire your worship in a fresh new way! </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="10"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A1Ljl32SqRc"><strong>Kim Walker-Smith - “Throne Room”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-medium">As Christians, we have a God that wants us to boldly come before Him (<a href="https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Hebrews%204:16&amp;version=NIV">Hebrews 4:16</a>), not only in our prayers but also in our worship of Him. The chorus of “Throne Room” emphasizes this genuine worship and how humbled we become when we come before a holy God. Let this song encourage you to run into His presence — it will leave you filled with awe and wonder! </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="9"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4FC0NYDE14E"><strong>Amanda Lindsey Cook - “Awakening”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-medium">Loosely inspired by <a href="https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Lamentations+3%3A22-23&amp;version=NIV">Lamentations 3:22-23</a>, this original song not only praises God for the many ways He redeems us each day, but it also serves as a testimony to artist Amanda Lindsey Cook’s faith despite her open struggles with anxiety and depression. Even in our struggles, God has the power to give us new life. Just like Cook, we hope your spirit will be awakened by this song, too! </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="8"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iFw42tZVDKI"><strong>Lauren Daigle - “Here’s My Heart”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-medium">As we grow up, we become so used to the idea of independence and doing everything on our own that we often forget to rely on God for anything. This song recaptures the beautiful picture of childlike dependence on our Heavenly Father… the way He created us to be. </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="7"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rHlRSZkz5vU"><strong>Brian &amp; Jenn Johnson - “Gravity”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-medium">During times of stress or anxiety, we can become so caught up in our problems that we lose sight of what matters most to God — spending time in His presence. This song will help you do just that. </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="6"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M9GcyHpptMk"><strong>Hillsong UNITED - “Oceans (Where Feet May Fail)”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-medium">Inspired by <a href="https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Matthew+14%3A22-32&amp;version=NIV">Matthew 14:22-32</a> where Jesus calls Peter out onto the water in a step of faith, this worship classic reveals that Jesus’ character will never fail, even when our feet do. It is only in His presence that we will be made stronger in our faith (<a href="https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=James+1%3A2-4&amp;version=NIV">James 1:2-4</a>). Allow this song to soak into your heart, and let God speak to you while worshiping Him. We hope these lyrics will be your soul’s anthem — <em>“Spirit lead me where my trust is without borders/Let me walk upon the waters wherever you would call me/Take me deeper than my feet could ever wander/And my faith will be made stronger in the presence of my Savior.”</em> </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="5"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XFkDqQtfs0w"><strong>Steffany Gretzinger - “Out of Hiding (Father’s Song)”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-medium">Written by singer-songwriters Steffany Gretzinger and Amanda Lindsey Cook, this song imagines what it would be like for the Father to call to His children, <em>“Come out of hiding.”</em> And the outro of the song — <em>“Baby, you’re almost home now/Please don’t quit now/You’re almost home to me”</em> — will be sure to connect you to the Father’s heart. </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="4"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6xx0d3R2LoU"><strong>Cory Asbury - “Reckless Love”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-medium">Many worship songs speak of God’s love for us, but none are quite like the award-winning original “Reckless Love.” Based on the Parable of the Lost Sheep in <a href="https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Luke+15%3A1-7&amp;version=NIV">Luke 15:1-7</a>, this song praises God for His unconditional love that never gives up on us, even when we don’t deserve His kindness. Even though you may have listened to the song in church a million times before, we encourage you to take some time to really listen to the lyrics and worship the God that recklessly loves you. </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="3"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aFxOGd4P4JA"><strong>Kari Jobe - “Speak To Me”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-medium">What a great privilege it is to speak with the Creator of the universe! As followers of Christ, we make it a priority to pray to God each day, and He welcomes that. But how many of us let Him speak to us? Instead of hearing God’s voice, we only hear our own words, acting as if prayer is a one-way monologue rather than a two-way conversation. Allow this calming song to create a desire to listen to Him. </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium" start="2"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3WPbs7N-E0Q"><strong>Bethel Music &amp; Brian Johnson - “Have It All”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-medium">With Brian Johnson as the worship leader, this song was born out of a difficult time for the artist as he struggled with an intense nervous breakdown. His song “Have It All” is one of vulnerably surrendering everything before God. Once we can let go of our control and desires, we are truly able to sing the chorus — <em>“You can have it all, Lord/Every part of my world/Take this life and breathe on/This heart that is now yours.”</em> </p></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><ol class="font-medium"><li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zp6aygmvzM4"><strong>Elevation Worship ft. Kari Jobe &amp; Cody Carnes - “The Blessing”</strong></a></li></ol></div></div><div class="container"><div class="row"><p class="font-medium">Released just a week before the coronavirus pandemic hit the U.S., “The Blessing” could not have come at a more opportune time. Full of scriptural references, this song declares God’s blessing and protection over His children. In fact, the first verse of the song is taken directly from <a href="https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Numbers+6%3A24-26&amp;version=NIV">Numbers 6:24-26</a>, where God revealed the Priestly Blessing benediction to Moses which was to be spoken over the people of Israel in ancient times. Even today, this benediction song is now more relevant than ever. We anticipate that both the powerful words and entrancing melody will soon make this song a new worship favorite among churches. </p></div></div></div></div></article></main><footer id="footer" class="footer"><div class="container"><div class="d-flex row"><div class="footer-liquid-app col-sm-6 col-12"><a class="liquid-app-download" href="/app"><div class="liquid-app-icon liquid-icon"></div><div class="liquid-app-text">Download the <br/> Liquid Church App</div><div class="liquid-app-arrow"><i fill="currentColor" style="display:inline-block;vertical-align:text-bottom"><svg fill="currentColor" style="display:inline-block;vertical-align:middle" height="30" width="30" viewBox="0 0 20 20"><path d="M13.25,10L6.109,2.58c-0.268-0.27-0.268-0.707,0-0.979c0.268-0.27,0.701-0.27,0.969,0l7.83,7.908\r\n' +

https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/message-image/Easter2020.jpg?auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=8192 8192w"/></div><div class="row"><div class="col-10 offset-1"><div class="font-large series-hero-description"><span style="font-weight:400">In this unprecedented time of uncertainty and fear, it might seem strange to celebrate. But on Easter weekend, we can experience fresh HOPE from the life-changing power of Jesus&#x27; resurrection! Amidst this crisis, let&#x27;s come together as a community and choose faith over fear, peace over panic, and worship over worry! Our Easter message will inspire your whole family as we&#x27;re reminded: This pandemic is not permanent-- but our hope in Christ is! </span></div></div></div></div></section><section class="fullwidth-section media-cards" style="background-color:#F8F8F8"><div class="container"><div class="row"><div class="col-md-12 col-12 offset-md-0 offset-0"><h6 class="font-section-header"> </h6></div></div><div class="row"><div class="media-card-wrap col"><a class="media-card-link" href="/message/bittersweet-easter"><div class="media-card card"><img class="card-img-top" width="262" src="https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/message-image/Bittersweet-Easter.jpg?ar=16%3A9&amp;fit=crop&amp;w=262&amp;auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=262" srcSet="https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/message-image/Bittersweet-Easter.jpg?ar=16%3A9&amp;fit=crop&amp;w=262&amp;auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=262&amp;q=75&amp;dpr=1 1x, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/message-image/Bittersweet-Easter.jpg?ar=16%3A9&amp;fit=crop&amp;w=262&amp;auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=262&amp;q=50&amp;dpr=2 2x, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/message-image/Bittersweet-Easter.jpg?ar=16%3A9&amp;fit=crop&amp;w=262&amp;auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=262&amp;q=35&amp;dpr=3 3x, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/message-image/Bittersweet-Easter.jpg?ar=16%3A9&amp;fit=crop&amp;w=262&amp;auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=262&amp;q=23&amp;dpr=4 4x, https://liquidchurch.imgix.net/message-image/Bittersweet-Easter.jpg?ar=16%3A9&amp;fit=crop&amp;w=262&amp;auto=format&amp;ixlib=react-9.0.2&amp;w=262&amp;q=20&amp;dpr=5 5x"/><div class="list-group list-group-flush"><div class="list-group-item"><div class="media-card-title font-h2">Bittersweet Easter</div><div class="media-card-blurb font-small"><p>In the midst of a painful pandemic, Easter can feel surreal. When those we love suffer &amp; Jesus doesn’t help right away, we can wonder “Where’s God in all this?” But Easter shows that Christ is with us when we suffer– and He’s planning something even better!</p></div></div><div class="media-card-series font-h3 list-group-item"><div class="media-card-series-title">Easter 2020</div><div class="media-card-series-part"></div></div><div font-h1">The Church was never about buildings.</h1><p class="homepage-hero-text font-large">The Church has always been about people rallying together, following Jesus, and sharing God&#x27;s love with our neighbors. While the methods change, the mission never does. During this time, where large gatherings are limited, we can still be part of God&#x27;s mission and be the Church.</p><div class="homepage-hero-cta"><a id="hero-cta" class="btn font-btn-large blue-btn" href="/live">Watch Church Online</a></div></div></div></section><section class="site-section both" style="background-color:#F8F8F8"><div class="container"><div class="row"><div class="page-strap-col vertical-center col"><h2 class="statement large tall light align-center">No matter who you are or where you&#x27;ve been, you&#x27;re welcome here.</h2><div class="sidekick large tall light align-center">At Liquid, you&#x27;ll be welcomed into a friendly, casual environment by people who are excited to see you. All you have to do from here is come as you are and find out more for yourself!</div><div class="cta large tall light align-center"><a class="cta-text font-link center"
